sen.j: 丹後大仏（たんごだいぶつ）は、京都府与謝郡伊根町本坂にある大仏である。
sen.e: Tango Daibutsu (Great Buddha) is a large statue of Buddha in Honzaka, Ine-cho, Yosa-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Tango Daibutsu (Great Buddha) is a large statue of Buddha in Honzaka, Ine-cho, Yosa-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Tango Daibutsu (Great Buddha) is a large statue of Buddha in Honzaka, Ine-cho, Yosa-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 現在の大仏（石造）は二代目で、初代は青銅製だった。
sen.e: The present Daibutsu (built of stone) is the second generation and the first generation was built of bronze.
The present Daibutsu (built of stone) is the second generation and the first generation was built of bronze.
The present Daibutsu (built of stone) is the second generation and the first generation was built of bronze.
The size is less than 2.2m (Daibutsu only).
The size is less than 2.2m (Daibutsu only).
The size is less than 2.2m (Daibutsu only).

sen.j: 人のほうが大きく見えるため、1.5mほどだと言う説もある。
sen.e: Since a person looks higher than it, some people say it is about 1.5m high.
Since people look larger than the statue, some say it is about 1.5m high.
Since people look larger than the statue, some say it is about 1.5m high.
It is a seated statue.
It is a seated statue.
It is a seated statue.
(The abstract from an inscription for an explanation)
(The abstract from an inscription for an explanation)
(The abstract from an inscription for an explanation)

sen.j: 流行性感冒（インフルエンザ）で亡くなった、42人のシルク工場従業員の慰霊のため。
sen.e: It was founded to console the souls of forty-two employees of the silk factory who were killed by the flu.
It was founded to console the souls of forty-two employees of the silk factory who were killed by the flu.
It was founded to console the souls of 42 employees of the silk factory who were killed by the flu.

sen.j: 京都府与謝郡伊根町本坂
sen.e: Honzaka, Ine-cho, Yosa-gun, Kyoto Prefecture
Honzaka, Ine-cho, Yosa-gun, Kyoto Prefecture
Honzaka, Ine-cho, Yosa-gun, Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 青銅製の大仏で、高さは現在のものとあまり変わらなかったと思われる（初代大仏の画像などが存在しないため、詳細は不明）。
sen.e: It seems that it was made by bronze and as high as the present one (For the lack of image of the first Daibutsu, details are unclear).
It seems that it was made by bronze and as high as the present one (For the lack of image of the first Daibutsu, details are unclear).
It seems that it was made by bronze and as high as the present one (For the lack of image of the first Daibutsu, details are unclear).

sen.j: 1917年（大正7年）：流行性感冒のため、東京慰安旅行に向かった従業員42人が死亡。
sen.e: In 1917: the forty-two employees who went on a trip for an excursion to Tokyo were killed by the flu.
In 1917: the forty-two employees who went on a trip for an excursion to Tokyo were killed by the flu.
1917: The 42 employees who went on a trip for an excursion to Tokyo were killed by the flu.

sen.j: 1917年～1920年頃（大正7年～10年頃）：与謝郡伊根町本坂に、工場長自ら大仏を建造（資料が一切なく、この辺りの年代はかなり曖昧である）
sen.e: From 1917 to around 1920: the factory manager himself built the Daibutsu at Honzaka, Ine-cho, Yosa-gun (since there is no record, this time is very obscure).
From 1917 to around 1920: the factory manager himself built the Daibutsu at Honzaka, Ine-cho, Yosa-gun (since there is no record, this time is very obscure).
From 1917 to around 1920: The factory manager himself built the Daibutsu at Honzaka, Ine-cho, Yosa-gun (Since there is no record, this time is very obscure).

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）頃：金属製であったことが災いし解体される。
sen.e: In 1944: it was scrapped unfortunately for having been made of metal.
In 1944: it was scrapped unfortunately for having been made of metal.
1944: It was scrapped unfortunately for having been made of metal.

sen.j: 戦争で使う銃弾となったと思われる。
sen.e: It seems that it was caste into bullets for the war.
It seems that it was cast into bullets for the war.
It seems that it was cast into bullets for the war.

sen.j: 1945年（昭和20年）：初代丹後大仏と同じ場所に建造される。
sen.e: In 1945: it was built at the same place of the first Tango Daibutsu.
In 1945: it was built at the same place of the first Tango Daibutsu.
1945: It was built at the same place of the first Tango Daibutsu.

sen.j: 以後現在までずっと存在し続けている。
sen.e: After that, it has existed until now.
After that, it continues to exist to this day.
After that, it continues to exist to this day.

sen.j: 公共交通機関がないため、車で向かうしかない。
sen.e: Since there is no public transportation, there is no way except going by a car.
Since there is no public transportation, there is no way to reach it, except by car.
Since there is no public transportation, there is no way to reach it, except by car.
